intro: Cyrtanthus varius, commonly known as the variable crocus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bowl-shaped flowers that come in a range of colors, including white, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Cyrtanthus varius is a perennial herb that produces showy blooms in late spring to early summer. Its unique morphology and vibrant flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and woodland settings.
